Class Seat

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameObject
      • Seat

  • public class Seat
extends GameObject
    This class holds the Transform, Sprite, and BoxCollider for the auditorium seats seen on the Playingfield during a game session.
    See Also:
    Sprite, BoxCollider, PlayingField, Transform

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class GameObject

        collider, sprite, transform

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Seat(int x, int y)
      This constructor assigns the Seat a coordinate in the PlayingField using the parameters passed in and initializes this seat's moleAtSeat member variable, used for tracking what Mole is placed behind this Seat, to null.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Seat

        public Seat(int x,
            int y)
        This constructor assigns the Seat a coordinate in the PlayingField using the parameters passed in and initializes this seat's moleAtSeat member variable, used for tracking what Mole is placed behind this Seat, to null. This constructor also manufactures the seat's Transform, Sprite, and BoxCollider using appropriate formulas, resources, and constants as specified in the Global class.
        Parameters:
        x - the horizontal component of this Seat object's placement on the PlayingField grid which is measured in units of seats.
        y - the vertical component of this Seat object's placement on the PlayingField grid which is measured in units of seats.
        See Also:
        PlayingField

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(long elapsedTime)
        This method overrides the GameObject class's update() method. Currently it simply calls the super class's method.
        Overrides:
        update in class GameObject
        See Also:
        GameObject.update(long)

      • fillSeat

        public void fillSeat(Mole m)
        Places the Mole passed in as a parameter into a member variable of this Seat . It also calls the Mole parameter's Mole#setSeatMoleIsAt(Mole) method for the Mole to register what Seat it is at.
        Parameters:
        m - the Mole to be placed at this Seat

      • emptySeat

        public void emptySeat()
        Sets this seat's moleAtSeat variable which points to the Mole that currently occupies this Seat to null. This method is used when a Mole finishes an up and down phase to prep it for being moved to another Seat or when a player whacks the Mole either correctly or incorrectly.

      • getMoleAtSeat

        public Mole getMoleAtSeat()
        Returns:
        returns the Mole object at this Seat

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        returns the String "Seat"
